definitions.definition: the part of existence that is measured in minutes, days, years, etc., or this process considered as a whole:
examples: He wants to spend more time with his family.
I wish you'd stop criticizing me all the time.
The kids ate their dinner in no time.

definitions.definition: If you say there is or that you have no time to lose, it means that you must do quickly whatever it is that you want to do:
examples: Come on, there's no time to lose, we have to get home before John finds out.
I will love you for all time.

definitions.definition: that has ever lived or existed:
examples: She's been called the greatest singer of all time.

definitions.definition: to decide that something will happen at a particular time:
examples: [ + to infinitive ] We timed our trip to coincide with my cousin's wedding.

definitions.definition: to arrange something so that it happens at the best possible time:
examples: If you time your departure carefully, you should be able to miss the worst of the traffic.

definitions.definition: the stated period of time during the year, day, etc.:
